sub_title: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV
summary:
-- Global marketing, integration and innovation professional whose entrepreneurial leadership and creativity produce outstanding results for organizations who must innovate in order to grow. --

The global marketplace is a constantly evolving ecosystem. Large organizations are plotting their course through turnarounds, re-inventions and expansions -- and require transformative approaches to do so.

Startups are disrupting large organizations at an ever-increasing rate. When you look at the numbers, Startups are failing more than succeeding. I can pinpoint the absolute must-haves for startups to succeed on a case-by-case basis.

Investors, whether Angel, Seed, Venture or Private Equity are placing their bets . . . . and sometimes it seems like a roll of the dice. I have a way to methodically reduce this uncertainty.

My passion is defining and delivering dynamic, innovation capabilities and new ideas recognized for producing outstanding growth and profitability for companies – both large and small, brands, investors and people ... even amidst complex organizational and marketplace challenges.

I am a wholehearted believer in the power of integrated communications and have developed an expertise in cross-business and cross-geography collaboration. My leadership makes connections happen -- whether that connection is between the internal and external; the business and the agency mix; or the idea and the implementation.

organizations.name: Hogeschool Rotterdam, Willem de Kooning Academy

projects.title: E*TRADE Financial Corporation - Innovation Communications Program Development - USA
projects.description:
1) Create and execute a robust internal communications program to introduce Innovation as a discipline at E*TRADE. The program was designed to educate, inform, interact with and inspire employees and consisted of a multi-tiered messaging strategy, intranet development, content maps, editorial management and community building activities both on and offline.

2) Develop and manage E*TRADE’s first, company-wide Innovation Challenge where employees led development of substantial business ideas (+/-$100MM). Believing that the best ideas come from a company’s front lines, the first competition is a pilot and was supported by a comprehensive communications package, tools and tutorials, proprietary research, mentors and coaches, an intranet micro site and a robust and personal recognition system.

contributors.headline: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV

projects.title: Reader's Digest Association - Global Product Launch - Western Europe, Eastern Europe, South America, Russia and Asia
projects.description:
Directed brand strategy, name/identity, product packaging and integrated marketing communications program for a range of multi-media entertainment and educational English language learning products.

Led an 8-week agency selection process to engage a global advertising/direct marketing company to launch the new brand and product portfolio in 22+ markets worldwide. 

• Researched agencies • Prepared briefs • Evaluated agency presentations • Facilitated decision • Negotiated and contracted agency • Managed the campaign development

• The engagement was extended to include directing the London based agency both strategically and creatively to test the program in 6 markets prior to rollout and including Media Planning. (Brazil, Russia, Czech Republic, France, Romania and Hong Kong)

contributors.headline: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV

projects.title: Reader's Digest Association - Brand strategy & online experience - Benelux
projects.description:
Created a brand strategy and research plan consisting of two scenarios to be tested among customers and prospects for a new online book portal/e-commerce business and online community to be prototyped in the Netherlands before scaling to multiple countries.   Test results validated recommendation to launch a new brand, Boeken Buzz (The buzz about books)

Continued to lead and consult with the team on the development of the prototype and online experience design from wireframes to launch.

contributors.headline: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV

projects.title: ABN AMRO - Multi-National Marketing Campaign & New Company Launch - Amsterdam, The Netherlands
projects.description:
Developed the integrated marketing program to launch Risk Advisory Services (RAS), a division of ABN AMRO, one of the world’s largest banks in order to position the business for spin-off or sell-off. Marketing efforts focused on 4 global geographic regions (Asia, Middle East, Eastern Europe, and Western Europe).   

• Agency selection and contracting (UK-based PR agencies) • Brand strategy and identity development • Directed communications campaign • Website development • Media training of executives

contributors.headline: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV

projects.title: De Gule Sider A/S (The Yellow Pages) - Brand Strategy and Product Portfolio Development & Repositioning - Copenhagen, Denmark
projects.description:
Redeveloped and launched the print product portfolio to reposition the recently acquired Danish Yellow Pages against competitors within the highly competitive Danish market. 

Key activities included: brand/product strategy and positioning, product usability evaluation and redesign, new advertiser concepts, design and research agency selection and management, and consumer acceptance testing

contributors.headline: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV

projects.title: De Telefoongids, B.V. - Brand and Communications Manager - Amsterdam, The Netherlands
projects.description:
Reporting to the COO, directed all aspects of external communications for the Dutch national telephone directory including advertising campaign development, media planning, public relations and online marketing. Managed 6 FTE’s and an annual budget of 5 Mio Euros.   

Key activities include:
• Product marketing/communications planning • Advertising and PR agency selection • Directed integrated multi-media advertising campaigns. • Produced a multi-media co-advertising campaign in house • Spearheaded branded sponsorship of a national TV program • Developed a Corporate Social Responsibility Program • Designed a modular segmented sales support package for use by 400 sales representatives 

• Produced 46% usage increase of the directory assistance service 
• Increased monthly unique visitors to the website by 1M in a country with the population of 16M.
• DeTelefoongids became market leader during this period and was purchased out of Private Equity  by Macquarie Group.

contributors.headline: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV

projects.title: De Telefoongids, B.V. - Brand Migration and Repositioning Strategy - Amsterdam, The Netherlands
projects.description:
Developed 5-year brand migration strategy and implementation plan to transition the recently acquired Dutch national telephone directory from a Telco brand (KPN Telecom) to an independent brand – De Telefoongids (The Telephone Guide).  

Key activities include:
 • Devised the brand strategy • Brand architecture • Product development (50 regional print directories) (www.detelefoongids.nl) (0900-1313 directory assistance) (CD-ROM/Intranet apps) • Interior design corporate offices (600+ FTE’s) 
⇨	 De Telefoongids became market leader in terms of both revenue and usage, overtaking its main competitor the Yellow Pages 
⇨	Increased internet rank from 8th to 5th place nationally
⇨	Acquired from private equity investors 2.5 years ahead of schedule by Macquerie Group

contributors.headline: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV

projects.title: Coca Cola - Loyalty Program Promotion - Amsterdam, The Netherlands
projects.description:
Directed the concept, design and production teams to develop and manage a Website and supporting online advertising, email and SMS campaign for the “ Coca Cola Card”, a free loyalty card targeting teenagers and college students throughout the Netherlands. 
==>	The website captured data and tracked the use of over 700,000 card holders within the defined target group, the largest database of this highly sought after segment in the Netherlands.

contributors.headline: Co-Owner and Commercial Director of Whiskybase BV

profile_positions.description: Founded in 2007, Whiskybase is a company focused on managing and scaling a portfolio of whisky-related businesses possessing strong synergies within the dynamic and ever-changing world of whisk(e)y.  As Co-owner and Commercial Director, my role is to drive exponential growth within the portfolio of businesses both through B2C and B2B channels globally.
profile_positions.title: Co-Owner and Commercial Director

profile_positions.description:
ICX Whisky is an investment organization focused on whisky-related products and services, both online and offline, catering to B2C and B2B customers.

The team has worked internationally as consultants and managers to large and complex organizations facing ever-increasing pressure to transform and innovate digitally.

At its core, our unique and proven skills have been knowing how to harvest ideas and select the best ones efficiently and effectively. We then dimensionalize the opportunity with a business case and lead operational teams to execute and prove the winning ideas before scaling.

We are now leveraging this experience as Co-Owners of Whiskybase BV.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
The Innovation capability I developed at Wegener Media was about creating new and sustainable businesses based on Wegener's core assets and to the delight of the company's readers and partners. 

In the role of Head of Innovation, my key objectives were to:
• Identify the best ideas and develop these into concepts reaching new audiences and representing significant revenue potential. 
• Lead teams to think and work differently using the Lean Start-up method: "Fail fast, fail cheap". 
• Becoming an "Open"​ company and introducing an iterative approach whereby the company's audiences collaborated on the ideas to be further developed through our Innovation funnel.
• Building the tools & capabilities to continually innovate as a company empowering the internal workforce and supplying external expertise (freelance/agency) and thought leadership as needed.
• To fast-track new ideas through our Innovation funnel to validate and build businesses that can scale.

Wegener Media is the largest cross-media publisher of regional and local news and information in the Netherlands. Daily print, digital initiatives and multi-channel platforms reach millions of customers with news and information relevant to its communities in a way only Wegener can achieve.
profile_positions.title: Head of Innovation

profile_positions.location: Atlanta • New York City • London • Amsterdam • Copenhagen
profile_positions.description:
Working with organizational leaders, assignments focussed on ways to build value for organizations and their stakeholders through the brand experience.  All cases involve solving complex marketing and communication challenges with solutions requiring a thorough understanding of people, their needs, creativity in messaging and media as well as sales, technology and customer care. 

Projects were delivered using a combination of external specialists and/or agencies, technology partners and internal cross-functional client-side teams. Upon completion, external relationships are solidified and client-side teams are fully trained and prepared to move forward independently. 
  
Programs have been successfully executed in the US, Western Europe, Eastern Europe, Africa, Asia and South America. 

Specialties:
•	Global, Multi-national and National focus (A-Brand clients)
•	Integrated Communications Campaign Development (Creative Strategy/Direction)
•	B2C, B2B and Internal Communications (Change Management)
•	Agency Selection (Pitches) and Agency Management
•	Brand Architecture, Identity and Positioning/Repositioning
•	Product Portfolio Strategy, Development and Design
•	Multi-disciplinary Team Leader, Mentoring and Coaching


(See detailed client engagements in the "Projects" section below)
profile_positions.title: Global Marketing, Integration and Innovation Consultant

company.name: Change the Script, B.V. (A Publicis Network Company)

profile_positions.company: Change the Script, B.V. (A Publicis Network Company)
profile_positions.description:
Executive Creative Director within a 100+ strong, digital communications agency serving A-brand clients. Client responsibilities included preparation and delivery of communication concepts, strategies and planning, user experience design, content development and end-responsible for the overall creative product delivered by the agency. This included managing 45 full-time creatives in the areas of art direction, design, writing, content management, information architecture, trend forecasting, and front-end programming.

Clients include:
Coca-Cola • Renault • Compaq • Hoya Worldwide • Rituals • Postbank
profile_positions.title: Executive Creative Director & Client Service Director

profile_positions.description:
Defined and executed the firm’s new strategic direction to position itself as a boutique strategic communications firm. Identified staffing needs and recruited talent to deliver the proposition. 
Organizational responsibilities included leading marketing/new business initiatives, supervising a marketing services group, and the formation of a project management team and definition of account management procedures. 

• Agency revenue increased by 123% within one year
• Project profitability increased 40%
• Maintained an average personal billable utilization rate of more than 90% monthly.

Commercially and creatively responsible for directing all aspects of the Borders account including:
Borders USA • Borders International • Borders Cafe • Borders.com • Borders Outlets • Borders Group and specialized businesses such as Electronic Gift Cards, Small Business, Borders Visa, Borders Calendars and Borders Publishing.

Other clients included:
PriceWaterhouseCoopers • Prime Retail • CAEL • Crain's Chicago Business • National Geographic • DePaul College of Law
profile_positions.title: Creative Director & Account Director

profile_positions.description:
In a newly created corporate position, managed the development and lead the execution of all visual in-store communications programs and product lines within a national retail chain expanding from 26 to over 180 locations within a two-year period. 

• Borders became the nation’s 2nd largest retailer of entertainment products during this period.
• Borders became the national market leader in music sales.
• Borders became the #1 retailer of calendars nationally.
• Authored a co-advertising business plan and created a prototype consolidating 8 monthly digest catalogs into 1 monthly 64-page magalog, Inside Borders, with a free circulation of 100K, resulting in a net profit of  $1.5m, 2.3m and 4m over a three-year period.
• Created the first post-holiday sale “Bargain 5” resulting in over $10m additional revenue.
profile_positions.title: Visual Merchandising Manager & Creative Director
